0001220444.notes: single sector (5); tess-ebs period 7.162 d; prim eclipse depths of ~4% & very shallow secondary; SAP - lots of variability between eclipses; PDCSAP - similar to SAP;

0001449640.notes: two sectors (5 & 32); tess-ebs period 3.5 d; prim eclipse depths of ~2%; either negligible secondary eclipse or period is wrong; SAP - instrumental effects skew s32; PDCSAP - fixes skew -> better

0007695666.notes: two sectors @ 120 s (4 & 5); tess-ebs period ~17.5 d; clear & deep eclipses with secondary nr phase 0.17; PDCSAP flatter than SAP;

0013021029.notes: two sectors @ 120 s (5 & 32); tess-ebs period ~3.85 d; shallow eclipses of <2%; PDCSAP flatter than SAP;

0013957444.notes: two sectors @ 120 s (5 & 32); tess-ebs period ~3.74 d; clear eclipses - primary ~8% & secondary ~1.5%; secondary shallower than ideal but quick-fit indicates may be usable;

0031273263.notes: 20+ sectors; tess-ebs period ~22.5 d although it's likely double this; deep eclipses of ~20% but no sectors have more than 1; SAP - variability between eclipses; PDCSAP - discontinuities -> worse;
0031273263.exclude_reason: needs further investigation - may be able to get this to work by combining limited set of contiguous sectors

0300560295.notes: 20+ sectors; tess-ebs period ~20 d; eclipse depths of 2-4%; SAP - lots of stochastic variability between eclipses; PDCSAP - similar to SAP;
0300560295.exclude_reason: shallow eclipses with inconsistent depths; hints of extra eclipses in later sectors;

0150101472.notes: 20+ sectors; tess-ebs period ~3.3 d; SAP - no sectors with clear eclipses plus lots of instrumental effects; PDCSAP - improves on SAP with shallow eclipses visible
